The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 21 April is 41,730 (4,830 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 16 April, there were 140 new confirmed cases (16.2 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 09 April, there were 136 new cases and so the new cases have risen by 3% (4 extra cases).
